name: DataGrid
title: Data Grid
description: A flexible, MJ-aware data grid component wrapping Ant Design Table with sorting, filtering, paging, selection capabilities, and custom field formatting
functionalRequirements:
## Generic Reusable Data Grid for Drill-Down Scenarios

### Core Purpose
- **Generic, reusable table component** suitable for any application needing tabular data display
- **Ideal for drill-down interfaces** where users need to explore, filter, and select records for detailed inspection
- **Master-detail pattern support** through row selection events that trigger detail views or navigation
- **Universal data grid** that works with any entity type or data structure

### Key Capabilities
- Display any entity or record collection in a configurable table format
- Support drill-down workflows through row selection and event emission
- Enable exploratory data analysis with sorting, filtering, and paging
- Provide multiple selection patterns for bulk operations or single-record drill-down
- Text-based search with highlighting to quickly locate records of interest
- Custom field formatting and styling for rich data presentation
- Emit comprehensive events for integration with parent components and navigation
- Responsive design adapts to any container or screen size
- Loading states for async data and empty states with contextual messages
- Real-time filter match counting for user feedback

### Reusability Features
- Completely data-agnostic - works with any array of objects
- Flexible column configuration - simple strings or full column definitions
- Per-column customization with render functions, width, and sortability
- Backward compatible - accepts both simple field arrays and column definitions
- All features toggleable via props for different use cases
- Standard event interface for easy integration
- No hard dependencies on specific data structures
technicalDesign:
## Generic Reusable Component Architecture

### Design Philosophy
- **Fully generic and reusable** - no coupling to specific entities or schemas
- **Drill-down optimized** - events and selection modes designed for master-detail patterns
- **Composable** - easily embedded in dashboards, forms, or standalone pages
- **Framework-agnostic data model** - accepts any array of objects

### Component Structure
- Single, self-contained component wrapping Ant Design Table
- Zero assumptions about data structure beyond array of objects
- React hooks for local state management - no external state required
- Debounced filter input for performance with large datasets
- Memoized data processing prevents unnecessary re-renders

### Drill-Down Support
1. Row selection triggers events with full record data
2. Parent components can navigate or show details based on selection
3. Multiple selection modes support different drill-down patterns
4. Filter and sort state can be persisted for return navigation
5. Events provide all context needed for drill-down actions

### Integration Patterns
- **Master-Detail**: Use with detail panels for record exploration
- **Navigation**: Selection events trigger route changes
- **Modal Details**: Open detail modals on row selection
- **Bulk Operations**: Multi-select for batch processing
- **Report Tables**: Display-only mode for read-only data
- **Search Results**: Filterable, sortable result sets

### Key Technical Features
- Dynamic column generation from any field array or configuration
- Flexible field system supports both simple strings and advanced configurations
- Custom formatters and styles can be applied per field
- Smart type detection for sort comparisons and default formatting
- Highlight filter matches across all visible cells
- Configurable debounce prevents filter thrashing
- Row selection supports checkbox, radio, or row-click patterns
- Events include full context (selected data, filter state, page info)

### Column Configuration System
- **Simple Mode**: Pass field names as strings for default behavior
- **Advanced Mode**: Pass column definition objects with:
  - Custom render functions for complete control over cell content
  - Column-specific width and sortability settings
  - Custom column headers
  - Full access to record and field metadata in render callbacks
- **Backward Compatible**: Existing code using string arrays continues to work
- **Type-Aware**: Default formatting based on SQL field types when metadata available
- **Industry Standard**: Follows common table library patterns for familiarity

### ColumnDef Object Structure
Column definition objects support the following properties:
- **field** (string, required): The field name in the data object
- **header** (string, optional): Column header text. If not provided, uses field display name or field name
- **render** (function, optional): Custom render function (value, record, fieldInfo) => ReactNode
- **width** (string | number, optional): Column width (e.g., '200px', 200)
- **sortable** (boolean, optional): Whether this column can be sorted. Overrides global sorting

dataRequirements.description: Component is data-agnostic and works with any entity data passed via props

properties.name: entityName
properties.description: Name of the entity being displayed

properties.name: data
properties.description: Array of entity objects to display

properties.name: columns
properties.description: Array of column definitions. Can be simple strings (field names) for default behavior, or column definition objects with properties: field (required), header, render, width, sortable. If not provided, all fields will be displayed. See technical design section for complete ColumnDef structure.
properties.exampleValue: ["Name", { field: "Price", header: "Unit Price", render: (v) => `$${v}`, width: "120px", sortable: true }]

properties.name: pageSize
properties.description: Number of rows per page when paging is enabled

properties.name: filterFields
properties.description: Fields to search when filtering. If not specified, searches all fields

properties.name: filterDebounceTime
properties.description: Debounce time in ms for filter input

properties.name: longTextDisplay
properties.description: How to display long text that exceeds the threshold: 'truncate' shows ellipsis, 'expand' allows click to expand/collapse, 'tooltip' shows full text on hover, 'wrap' shows all text with wrapping, 'none' uses default behavior

properties.name: longTextThreshold
properties.description: Number of characters before long text display behavior is triggered

properties.name: autoFitColumns
properties.description: When true, columns auto-fit to container width. When false, columns use fixed widths with horizontal scrolling

events.name: rowClick
events.description: Fired when a row is clicked

parameters.name: record
parameters.description: The entity object of the clicked row

parameters.name: visibleRows
parameters.description: Array of entity objects visible on current page

parameters.name: matchingData
parameters.description: Array of all matching entity objects
